name: 状压 DP
complexity: Typically O(n * 2^n) or O(n * 3^n), where n is the number of bits/states.
scenarios: Problems with small state space (n ≤ 20-25) where each element can be in a small set of states (often binary).
Classic examples: placing kings/queens on a chessboard, traveling salesman problem (TSP), subset selection with constraints, graph coloring on small graphs.
extensions: DP with bitmask representing sets of vertices in graphs.
